cab.content: THIS DOCUMENT IS THE PROPERTY OF HIS BRITANNIC MAJESTY*3 GOVERNMENT-Printed for the War Cabinet. April 1945.SECRET. - Copy No. g-gW.M. (45)50th Conclusions.WAR CABINET 50 (45).CONCLUSIONS of a Meeting of the War Cabinet held in the Prime MinistersMap Room on Tuesday, 24tfA April, 1945, at 7 p.m.Present:The Right Hon. Winston S. Churchill, M.P., Prime Minister (in the Chair).The Right Hon. Sir John Anderson,M.P., Chancellor of the Exchequer.The Right Hon. Herbert Morrison,M-P-, Secretary of State for "theHome Department - and Minister ofHome Security.The Right Hon. Ernest Bevin, M.P.,Minister of Labour and NationalService.The Right Hon. Lord Woolton,Minister of Reconstruction.The following were also present:The Right Hon. Lord Beaverbrook,Lord Privy Seal.The Right Hon. Sir Stafford Cripps,K.C., M.P., Minister of aircraft production.The Right Hon. Richard Law, M.P.,Minister of State. aThe Right Hon. Sir ' archibald sinclair, Bt., M.P., Secretary ofState for Air.The Right Hon. Brendan Bracken,M.P., Minister of Information.Sir Orme Sargent, Deputy Under-Secretary of State for ForeignAffairs.Secretariat :Sir Edward Bridges.Mr. Norman Brook.Poland. The War Cabinet considered a series of telegrams from(Previous Washington reporting conversations which M. Molotov had hadEeference: with the Secretary of State for Foreign Affairs and the UnitedW.M.(45)44th States Secretary of State and with President Truman about theConclusions, arrangements for the reconstitution of the Polish Government.Minute 3.) The discussion and the conclusions reached "are recorded inthe Secretary's Standard File of War Cabinet Conclusions.[29935-6]
